Hello, I am Divya

A bit about me






Detail-oriented Banking and Finance professional with 5 years of experience across retail and corporate banking‚Äîspecializing in account maintenance, billing operations, and accounts payable. Recognized for exceptional customer service and delivering tailored solutions. Strong in AML/KYC compliance, risk management, and audit readiness. Adept at process improvement, workflow optimization, and cross-functional collaboration. Proficient in Data Analytics (Python, MySQL) and CRM tools, translating financial data into actionable insights that support business performance and strategic objectives.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
About Me
I am an MBA student at University Canada West with a background in banking, finance, and customer service. With five years of professional experience in backend banking operations and customer service at NatWest Group and Accenture Solutions, I bring a deep understanding of financial processes, risk mitigation, and compliance. I am certified in data analytics and passionate about applying technology and strategy to improve customer experience and operational excellence.

title: Projects
text:
üí≥ Enhancing Customer Experience & Digital Banking Adoption ‚Äî NatWest Group



Improved adoption of digital & self-serve banking platforms by 25%.


Needs-based conversations and cross-sell opportunities for everyday banking & credit cards.


Referral framework to specialist teams reduced turnaround time for financial solutions.


Digital guidance workshops ensured consistent education on mobile/online features.



Outcome: +15% customer satisfaction; contributed to branch business growth objectives.




üîí Strengthening Risk & Compliance Controls in Branch Operations ‚Äî NatWest Group



Checklist aligned with AML/KYC for compliant branch transactions.


Reported suspicious activity to compliance; reduced financial & reputational risk.


Standardized documentation across onboarding, billing, and account maintenance.


Partnered with RMs and ops to reduce exceptions by 18%.



Outcome: Passed internal audits with zero findings.
